</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>return_df</code> parameter can also be set to True to coerce the results into a pandas DataFrame.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">cats_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">breed_list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'cat'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">return_df</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">cats_df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[21]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>cat breeds</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>Abyssinian</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>American Curl</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>American Shorthair</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>3</th>
      <td>American Wirehair</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>4</th>
      <td>Applehead Siamese</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Please note the coercion to a pandas DataFrame removes the metadata returned in the JSON format to make the conversion process more efficient and straightforward.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>According to Petfinder's API documentation, the available animals to search are ['barnyard', 'bird', 'cat', 'dog', 'horse', 'reptile', 'smallfurry']. Searching for an animal not available in the Petfinder database will return a JSON object with a message stating 'invalid arguments'.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">breed_list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'zebra'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[16]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>{'@encoding': 'iso-8859-1',
 '@version': '1.0',
 'petfinder': {'@xmlns:xsi': 'http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance',
  '@xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation': 'http://api.petfinder.com/schemas/0.9/petfinder.xsd',
  'header': {'status': {'code': {'$t': '200'},
    'message': {'$t': 'invalid arguments'}},
   'timestamp': {'$t': '2017-11-21T19:06:51Z'},
   'version': {'$t': '0.1'}}}}</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Returning-random-Petfinder-pet-records">Returning random Petfinder pet records<a class="anchor-link" href="#Returning-random-Petfinder-pet-records">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>petpy</code> method <code>pet_getRandom()</code> provides a wrapper for the Petfinder <code>pet.getRandom</code> method. The potential results can be filtered to a subset by the method parameters, otherwise the method can be called simply as:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pet_getRandom</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[17]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>{'@encoding': 'iso-8859-1',
 '@version': '1.0',
 'petfinder': {'@xmlns:xsi': 'http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance',
  '@xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation': 'http://api.petfinder.com/schemas/0.9/petfinder.xsd',
  'header': {'status': {'code': {'$t': '100'}, 'message': {}},
   'timestamp': {'$t': '2017-11-21T19:06:54Z'},
   'version': {'$t': '0.1'}},
  'petIds': {'id': {'$t': '39801731'}}}}</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The default record output contains only the pet record's ID and the call's JSON metadata. If we wish to return a more complete random pet record, we can set the parameter <code>output</code> to <code>basic</code> (name, age, animal, breed, shelterID) or <code>full</code> (complete record with description).</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pet_getRandom</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">output</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'full'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[18]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>{'@encoding': 'iso-8859-1',

   'id': {'$t': '39881634'},
   'lastUpdate': {'$t': '2017-11-10T19:17:04Z'},
   'media': {'photos': {'photo': [{'$t': 'http://photos.petfinder.com/photos/pets/39881634/1/?bust=1510340490&width=60&-pnt.jpg',
       '@id': '1',
       '@size': 'pnt'},
      {'$t': 'http://photos.petfinder.com/photos/pets/39881634/1/?bust=1510340490&width=95&-fpm.jpg',
       '@id': '1',
       '@size': 'fpm'},
      {'$t': 'http://photos.petfinder.com/photos/pets/39881634/1/?bust=1510340490&width=500&-x.jpg',
       '@id': '1',
       '@size': 'x'},
      {'$t': 'http://photos.petfinder.com/photos/pets/39881634/1/?bust=1510340490&width=300&-pn.jpg',
       '@id': '1',
       '@size': 'pn'},
      {'$t': 'http://photos.petfinder.com/photos/pets/39881634/1/?bust=1510340490&width=50&-t.jpg',
       '@id': '1',
       '@size': 't'},
      {'$t': 'http://photos.petfinder.com/photos/pets/39881634/2/?bust=1510340495&width=60&-pnt.jpg',

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can also pull a specified number of pet records from the API by setting the <code>records</code> parameter and return the collected results as a pandas DataFrame by setting <code>return_df</code> to <code>True</code>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">random_pet_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pet_getRandom</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">records</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">return_df</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [20]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">random_pet_df</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Return-a-pet-record-associated-with-a-specific-petId">Return a pet record associated with a specific petId<a class="anchor-link" href="#Return-a-pet-record-associated-with-a-specific-petId">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>pet_get</code> method can be used to extract a full record from the Petfinder database. We use the pet ID retrieved from the previous call to <code>pet_getRandom</code> to illustrate.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pet</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pet_get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'26417898'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [20]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pet</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[20]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The record can also be returned as a <code>DataFrame</code>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pet_get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'39801731'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">return_df</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[21]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>pets_get()</code> method accepts a list or tuple and returns the records associated with each pet ID in the passed variable.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">petids</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">random_pet_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'id'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="c1"># get the pet IDs from the previous call by turning the id column into a list</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pets_get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">petids</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">return_df</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[27]:</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>pets_get()</code> method is essentially a convenience wrapper of <code>pet_get()</code>. The same results can be obtained by passing the variable to <code>pet_get()</code>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pet_get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">petids</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">return_df</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Finding-pet-records-matching-particular-search-criteria">Finding pet records matching particular search criteria<a class="anchor-link" href="#Finding-pet-records-matching-particular-search-criteria">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>pet.find()</code> method returns a collection of pet records that match the input search criteria. The available search criteria are listed in the <a href="http://petpy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#pet-methods">petpy API documentation</a>.</p>
<p>For example, let's say we are interested in finding female cats in Washington state and we want the results returned in a tidy pandas DataFrame.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">cats</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pet_find</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">location</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'WA'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">animal</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'cat'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sex</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'F'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">return_df</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">cats</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[9]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The default amount of records returned is 25, which can be changed by setting the <code>count</code> parameter. For large queries, it is recommended to set the <code>pages</code> parameter with a smaller <code>count</code> value. For example, if we wanted to return 1000 results, we could set the <code>pages</code> parameter to 10 and the <code>count</code> parameter to 100. Please note the Petfinder API places a hard cap of 2,000 results returned per query.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Shelter-Methods">Shelter Methods<a class="anchor-link" href="#Shelter-Methods">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Shelter methods are quite similar to the pet methods explored previously but return information on the animal welfare organizations available in Petfinder's database.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Finding-animal-welfare-organizations-in-a-certain-area">Finding animal welfare organizations in a certain area<a class="anchor-link" href="#Finding-animal-welfare-organizations-in-a-certain-area">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>shelter_find()</code> method can be used to return shelter records matching the input search criteria. Let's say we want to find 10 shelters listed in the Petfinder database located in Washington State as a pandas DataFrame.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">wa_shelters</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shelter_find</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">location</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'WA'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">count</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">return_df</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">wa_shelters</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[11]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Returning-specific-shelter-information">Returning specific shelter information<a class="anchor-link" href="#Returning-specific-shelter-information">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>shelter_get()</code> method returns the available information in the Petfinder database matching the given shelter ID. Shelter IDs can be found using the <code>shelter_find()</code> method used earlier. For example, let's use the method to return the record matching the first shelter ID in the result set obtained in the previous example.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">shelter_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wa_shelters</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'id'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shelter_get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">shelter_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[14]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>{'@encoding': 'iso-8859-1',
 '@version': '1.0',
 'petfinder': {'@xmlns:xsi': 'http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance',
  '@xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation': 'http://api.petfinder.com/schemas/0.9/petfinder.xsd',
  'header': {'status': {'code': {'$t': '100'}, 'message': {}},
   'timestamp': {'$t': '2017-11-22T16:00:53Z'},
   'version': {'$t': '0.1'}},
  'shelter': {'address1': {},
   'address2': {},
   'city': {'$t': 'Auburn'},
   'country': {'$t': 'US'},
   'email': {'$t': 'pugetsoundrescue@hotmail.com'},
   'fax': {},
   'id': {'$t': 'WA149'},
   'latitude': {'$t': '47.3191'},

   'name': {'$t': 'Puget Sound Rescue'},
   'phone': {},
   'state': {'$t': 'WA'},
   'zip': {'$t': '98092'}}}}</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>shelter_get()</code> method can also accept a list or tuple of shelter IDs. Internally, this calls a convenience wrapper method <code>shelters_get()</code>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shelters_get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">shelter_list</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">return_df</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The result obtained would be the same if one were to use the <code>shelter_get()</code> method and passed the same variable.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Extracting-pet-records-from-a-particular-shelter">Extracting pet records from a particular shelter<a class="anchor-link" href="#Extracting-pet-records-from-a-particular-shelter">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>shelter.getPets()</code> method returns the pet records that belong to a particular shelter ID. For example, let's say we want to return the pet records from the first shelter in our list as a DataFrame.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shelter_getPets</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">shelter_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">return_df</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[17]:</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Finding-shelters-that-have-records-matching-a-particular-animal-breed">Finding shelters that have records matching a particular animal breed<a class="anchor-link" href="#Finding-shelters-that-have-records-matching-a-particular-animal-breed">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>shelter_listByBreeds()</code> method allows the user to find shelters that match pet records of the input animal breed. This method is best used in conjunction with the <code>breed_list()</code> method to find the available animal breeds in the Petfinder database.</p>
<p>We already extracted the available cat breeds earlier in the introduction, which we can use to select a cat breed listed in the Petfinder database.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">cats_df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[23]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>cat breeds</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>Abyssinian</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>American Curl</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>American Shorthair</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>3</th>
      <td>American Wirehair</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>4</th>
      <td>Applehead Siamese</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The Abyssinian is a beautiful breed of cat, let's find some shelters that have pet records matching an Abyssinian breed and return it as a DataFrame.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">aby</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">cats_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'cat breeds'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [37]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shelter_listByBreed</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'cat'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">aby</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">return_df</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[37]:</div>
